headline: L3Harris Stock Rises. Guidance Was Confusing.
summary: Defense contractor  L3Harris  Technologies presented a mixed picture as it reported fourth-quarter earnings and issued confusing guidance.  Fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $2.86 a share topped the $2.76 a share analysts had forecast.  Revenue across all of the defense contractor’s business segments fell short of forecasts, with the exception of its integrated mission systems unit, which brought in $1.72 billion in the quarter, topping analysts’ calls for $1.64 billion.

headline: L3Harris quarterly revenue misses estimates on government shutdown pressures
summary: Jan 29 () - Defense contractor L3Harris Technologies missed Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue on Thursday, as a prolonged U. government shutdown delayed ​contract awards.

headline: L3Harris Stock Tumbles on Earnings. What’s Frightening Investors.
summary: Defense contractor  L3Harris  Technologies presented a mixed picture as it reported fourth-quarter earnings and issued soft guidance.  Fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $2.86 a share topped the $2.76 a share analysts had forecast.  Revenue across all of the defense contractor’s business segments fell short of forecasts, with the exception of its integrated mission systems unit, which brought in $1.72 billion in the quarter, topping analysts’ calls for $1.64 billion.

headline: L3Harris: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of eight analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.76 per share. The technology and communications company posted revenue of $5.65 billion in the period, which did not meet Street forecasts. Five analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $5.8 billion.
